info.title: Kanban Control Cycle
info.description:
The kanban OData API enables you to create and retrieve kanban control cycles and their kanban container data. Additionally, it is possible to change control cycles, to set the status both on control cycle and on container level, and to lock/unlock containers. Furthermore, you can add new containers for event-driven kanban control cycles and you can report the withdrawal out of one or more containers.

The service is based on the OData protocol and can be consumed by external systems and user interfaces.

x-sap-shortText: Use this service to create, change, or retrieve kanban control cycles and their kanban container data

values.text: [Material Replenishment with Kanban - In-House Production(4B3)](https://me.sap.com/processnavigator/SolP/4B3 " Link To BP ")
[Material Replenishment with Kanban - Stock Transfer(4B4)](https://me.sap.com/processnavigator/SolP/4B4 " Link To BP ")
[Material Replenishment with Kanban - External Procurement(1E3)](https://me.sap.com/processnavigator/SolP/1E3 " Link To BP ")

x-sap-extensible.description:
API can be extended by custom fields on the following business contexts (field usage for this API needs to be selected):
* Manufacturing: Kanban Container (PP_KANBAN_CONTAINER)
* Manufacturing: Kanban Control Cycle (PP_KANBAN_CONTROL_CYCLE)

[How to add an extension field to an API](https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/0f69f8fb28ac4bf48d2b57b9637e81fa/ce819b8557194ae0aa180ba4ac6a04de.html)

patch.summary: Updates a single kanban control cycle.
patch.description: Changes a kanban control cycle, for example the number of containers or the quantity per container.

delete.summary: Deletes an existing kanban control cycle.
delete.description: Removes a kanban control cycle that is not used anymore with all its underlying entities like kanban container delivery address and kanban containers.

post.summary: Sets the status of a kanban container.
post.description: Changes the status of a kanban container. If no target status is specified, it is determined according to the status definition. The operation returns the data of the changed kanban container.

parameters.name: KanbanContainer
parameters.description:
Kanban ID  
(Value needs to be enclosed in single quotes)

parameters.name: KanbanContainerStatus
parameters.description:
Kanban Status  
(Value needs to be enclosed in single quotes)

parameters.name: ActualQuantityInUnitOfEntry
parameters.description:
Actual Quantity  
(Value needs to be suffixed with `M`)

parameters.name: UnitOfEntry
parameters.description:
Unit  
(Value needs to be enclosed in single quotes)

parameters.name: Batch
parameters.description:
Batch  
(Value needs to be enclosed in single quotes)

parameters.name: KanbanCtnStatusChangeDateTime
parameters.description:
Time Stamp  
(Value needs to be enclosed in single quotes and prefixed with `datetimeoffset`, e.g. `datetimeoffset'2017-12-31T23:59:59Z'`)

parameters.name: DeliveryNote
parameters.description:
Delivery note  
(Value needs to be enclosed in single quotes)

post.summary: Sets the locking status of a kanban container.
post.description: Changes an existing kanban container to locked or unlocked in order to phase the container out or in. The operation returns the data of the changed kanban container.

parameters.name: KanbanContainer
parameters.description:
Kanban ID  
(Value needs to be enclosed in single quotes)

parameters.name: IsLocked
parameters.description: Kanban is Locked

post.summary: Sets the life cycle status of a kanban control cycle.
post.description: Changes the life cycle status of a kanban control cycle, to for example release an already existing control cycle to be used in production. The operation returns the data of the changed control cycle.

parameters.name: KanbanControlCycle
parameters.description:
Control Cycle  
(Value needs to be enclosed in single quotes)

parameters.name: KanbanCtrlCycleLifeCycleStatus
parameters.description:
Lifecycle Status  
(Value needs to be enclosed in single quotes)

post.summary: Adds a kanban container to an event-driven kanban control cycle.
post.description: Creates an additional container inside an event-driven kanban control cycle. The operation returns information about the new container.

parameters.name: KanbanControlCycle
parameters.description:
Control Cycle  
(Value needs to be enclosed in single quotes)

parameters.name: RequestedQuantityInBaseUnit
parameters.description:
Requested Quantity  
(Value needs to be suffixed with `M`)

parameters.name: RequestedDeliveryDateTime
parameters.description:
Time Stamp  
(Value needs to be enclosed in single quotes and prefixed with `datetimeoffset`, e.g. `datetimeoffset'2017-12-31T23:59:59Z'`)

parameters.name: PackingInstruction
parameters.description:
Packing instruction  
(Value needs to be enclosed in single quotes)

parameters.name: NumberOfLoadCarriers
parameters.description: No.Load Carriers

post.summary: Withdraws a quantity from a control cycle.
post.description: Reduces the quantity in one or more containers of the given control cycle. The operation returns the data of the kanban containers from which the quantity was withdrawn.

parameters.name: KanbanControlCycle
parameters.description:
Control Cycle  
(Value needs to be enclosed in single quotes)

parameters.name: KanbanCtrlCycWthdrwlQtyInBsUnt
parameters.description:
Withdrawal quantity  
(Value needs to be suffixed with `M`)

post.summary: Withdraws a given quantity from a kanban container.
post.description: Reduces the quantity in a container by a given number. The operation returns the data of the changed kanban container.

parameters.name: KanbanContainer
parameters.description:
Kanban ID  
(Value needs to be enclosed in single quotes)

parameters.name: KanbanCtnWithdrawalQtyInBsUnt
parameters.description:
Withdrawal quantity  
(Value needs to be suffixed with `M`)

post.description:
Group multiple requests into a single request payload, see [Batch Requests](https://help.sap.com/doc/5890d27be418427993fafa6722cdc03b/Cloud/en-US/OdataV2.pdf#page=152).

*Please note that "Try it out" is not supported for this request.*

multipart/mixed;boundary=request-separat.example:
--request-separator
Content-Type: application/http
Content-Transfer-Encoding: binary

GET A_KanbanContainer HTTP/1.1
Accept: application/json


--request-separator--

multipart/mixed.example:
--response-separator
Content-Type: application/http

HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Content-Type: application/json

{...}
--response-separator--
